tmpls.name: Card 1

fields:
Intuition: Weigh tokens by relevance to each other in sequence
Formula: Attention(Q,K,V) = softmax(QK^T/√d_k)V
Symbols: Q=query, K=key, V=value, d_k=key dimension
Why: Enables parallel computation and long-range dependencies

Parallelization: All positions computed simultaneously
Long-range: Direct connections between any two positions
Interpretability: Attention weights show model focus
Performance: Better at capturing dependencies in long sequences
What are the key components of transformer architecture?

Multi-head attention: Parallel attention mechanisms
Position encoding: Inject sequence order information
Layer norm + residual: Training stability
Feed-forward: Non-linear transformations per position
What is BERT and how does it work?

Architecture: Bidirectional encoder-only transformer
Training: Masked language modeling + next sentence prediction
Innovation: Bidirectional context understanding
Usage: Pre-train then fine-tune for downstream tasks
What is GPT and how does it differ from BERT?

GPT: Autoregressive, decoder-only, left-to-right
BERT: Bidirectional, encoder-only, masked training
Use: GPT for generation, BERT for understanding
Training: GPT predicts next token, BERT fills masks
What is transfer learning in NLP?

Approach: Pre-train on large corpus, fine-tune on task
Benefits: Better performance, less task-specific data needed
Examples: BERT, GPT, RoBERTa, T5
Process: Unsupervised pre-training → supervised fine-tuning
